history.proof: intros P H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 H7 ir. induction ir as [| ir' ir'' IH]. - apply H1. - destruct ir' as [k | k | k]. + shelve. + apply H6. + shelve.

ctx: intros P H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 H7 ir.
induction ir as [| ir' ir'' IH].
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 2 branches.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: Type
K_eq_dec: forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y}

Goal:
forall P : list IR -> Prop -> Prop, P [] True -> (forall k : K, P [IRI k] False) -> (forall (k k' : K) (ir : list IR), P (IRI k :: IRI k' :: ir) False) -> (forall (k k' : K) (ir : list IR), P ir (good_trace ir) -> P (IRI k :: IRO k' :: ir) (k = k' /\ good_trace ir)) -> (forall (k k' : K) (ir : list IR), P ir (good_trace ir) -> P (IRI k :: IRU k' :: ir) (k = k' /\ good_trace ir)) -> (forall (k : K) (ir : list IR), P (IRO k :: ir) False) -> (forall (k : K) (ir : list IR), P (IRU k :: ir) False) -> forall ir : list IR, P ir (good_trace ir)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive True : Prop := I : True
Inductive IR : Type := IRI : K -> IR | IRO : K -> IR | IRU : K -> IR
good_trace = fix good_trace (l : list IR) : Prop := match l with | [] => True | [IRI k] | IRI k :: IRI _ :: _ => False | IRI k :: IRO k' :: l' | IRI k :: IRU k' :: l' => k = k' /\ good_trace l' | _ => False end : list IR -> Prop Arguments good_trace _%list_scope
Inductive False : Prop := 
good_trace_ind' : forall (P : list IR -> Prop -> Prop) (l : list IR), P [] True -> (forall k : K, P [IRI k] False) -> (forall (k k' : K) (l0 : list IR), P (IRI k :: IRI k' :: l0) False) -> (forall (k k' : K) (l0 : list IR), P l0 (good_trace l0) -> P (IRI k :: IRO k' :: l0) (k = k' /\ good_trace l0)) -> (forall (k k' : K) (l0 : list IR), P l0 (good_trace l0) -> P (IRI k :: IRU k' :: l0) (k = k' /\ good_trace l0)) -> (forall (k : K) (l0 : list IR), P (IRO k :: l0) False) -> (forall (k : K) (l0 : list IR), P (IRU k :: l0) False) -> P l (good_trace l)
acknowledge_all_ops_ind : forall P : list op -> list IR -> Prop, P [] [] -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) out) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out)) -> forall (l : list op) (l0 : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops l l0 -> P l l0
acknowledge_all_ops_sind : forall P : list op -> list IR -> SProp, P [] [] -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) out) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: out)) -> (forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> P tr out -> P (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out)) -> forall (l : list op) (l0 : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops l l0 -> P l l0
Inductive acknowledge_all_ops : list op -> list IR -> Prop := AAO_nil : acknowledge_all_ops [] [] | AAO_IU : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out) | AAO_I_dorp : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) out | AAO_IO : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out ->...-> acknowledge_all_ops (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out) Arguments acknowledge_all_ops (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_IU _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_I_dorp _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_IO _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments AAO_O _ (_ _)%list_scope
equivalent = fun (l : list op) (ir : list IR) => good_trace ir /\ (exists ir' : list IR, acknowledge_all_ops l ir' /\ IR_equivalent ir' ir) : list op -> list IR -> Prop Arguments equivalent (_ _)%list_scope
AAO_IU : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: IRU k :: out)
AAO_IO : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) (IRI k :: out)
acknowledge_all_ops_was_in : forall (l : list op) (ir : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops l ir -> forall k : K, In (IRI k) ir -> In (I k) l
IR_ind : forall P : IR -> Prop, (forall k : K, P (IRI k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRO k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRU k)) -> forall i : IR, P i
acknowledge_all_ops_func_IRU_In : forall (l : list op) (ir : list IR) (k : K), In (IRU k) (acknowledge_all_ops_func l ir) -> In (I k) l
IR_sind : forall P : IR -> SProp, (forall k : K, P (IRI k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRO k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRU k)) -> forall i : IR, P i
IR_rect : forall P : IR -> Type, (forall k : K, P (IRI k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRO k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRU k)) -> forall i : IR, P i
IR_rec : forall P : IR -> Set, (forall k : K, P (IRI k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRO k)) -> (forall k : K, P (IRU k)) -> forall i : IR, P i
AAO_O : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (O k :: tr) (IRO k :: out)
IR_equivalent_ind : forall P : list IR -> list IR -> Prop, P [] [] -> (forall (x : IR) (xs ys : list IR), IR_equivalent xs ys -> P xs ys -> P (x :: xs) (x :: ys)) -> (forall (x y : IR) (xs ys : list IR), IR_equivalent xs ys -> P xs ys -> good_move x y -> P (x :: y :: xs) (y :: x :: ys)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list IR, IR_equivalent l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> IR_equivalent l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list IR, IR_equivalent l l0 -> P l l0
IR_equivalent_sind : forall P : list IR -> list IR -> SProp, P [] [] -> (forall (x : IR) (xs ys : list IR), IR_equivalent xs ys -> P xs ys -> P (x :: xs) (x :: ys)) -> (forall (x y : IR) (xs ys : list IR), IR_equivalent xs ys -> P xs ys -> good_move x y -> P (x :: y :: xs) (y :: x :: ys)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list IR, IR_equivalent l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> IR_equivalent l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list IR, IR_equivalent l l0 -> P l l0
AAO_I_dorp : forall (k : K) (tr : list op) (out : list IR), ~ acknowledged_op k tr -> acknowledge_all_ops tr out -> acknowledge_all_ops (I k :: tr) out
good_move = fun x y : IR => (forall k k' : K, ~ (x = IRO k /\ y = IRI k')) /\ (forall k : K, ~ (x = IRI k /\ y = IRO k)) /\ (forall k : K, ~ (x = IRI k /\ y = IRU k)) : IR -> IR -> Prop
Permutation_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), P [] [] -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, Permutation l l0 -> P l l0
Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P [] [] -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, Permutation l l0 -> P l l0
Permutation_ind_bis : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P [] [] -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l l' : list A), Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l')) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l' : list A, Permutation l l' -> P l l'
Sorted.LocallySorted_sind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall a : A, P [a]) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), Sorted.LocallySorted R (b :: l) -> P (b :: l) -> R a b -> P (a :: b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Sorted.LocallySorted R l -> P l
Sorted.LocallySorted_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall a : A, P [a]) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), Sorted.LocallySorted R (b :: l) -> P (b :: l) -> R a b -> P (a :: b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Sorted.LocallySorted R l -> P l
IR_equiv_eg3 : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> IR_equivalent [IRI k; IRI k'; IRO k'; IRO k] [IRI k'; IRO k'; IRI k; IRO k]
IR_equiv_eg4 : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> IR_equivalent [IRI k; IRI k'; IRO k'; IRO k] [IRI k; IRO k; IRI k'; IRO k']
IR_equiv_eg2 : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> IR_equivalent [IRI k; IRI k'; IRO k; IRO k'] [IRI k'; IRO k'; IRI k; IRO k]
rev_list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P (rev l) -> P (rev (a :: l))) -> forall l : list A, P (rev l)
assoc_set : forall K V : Type, (forall k k' : K, {k = k'} + {k <> k'}) -> list (K * V) -> K -> V -> list (K * V)
assoc : forall K V : Type, (forall k k' : K, {k = k'} + {k <> k'}) -> list (K * V) -> K -> option V
IR_equiv_eg1 : forall k k' : K, k <> k' -> IR_equivalent [IRI k; IRI k'; IRO k; IRO k'] [IRI k; IRO k; IRI k'; IRO k']
rev_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (l ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
acknowledge_all_ops_func_target_ext : forall (l : list op) (t t' : list IR), (forall k : K, In (IRU k) t -> In (IRU k) t') -> (forall k : K, In (IRU k) t' -> In (IRU k) t) -> acknowledge_all_ops_func l t = acknowledge_all_ops_func l t'
a_equiv : (forall k k' : ?K, {k = k'} + {k <> k'}) -> list (?K * ?V) -> list (?K * ?V) -> Prop where ?K : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- Type] ?V : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- Type]
step_failure_ind : forall P : list name * network -> list name * network -> list (name * (input + list output)) ->...-> P p p0 l where ?P0 : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- BaseParams] ?P : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- MultiParams ?P0] ?params : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- FailureParams ?P]
acknowledged_op_dec : forall (k : K) (tr : list op), {acknowledged_op k tr} + {~ acknowledged_op k tr}
step_failure_sind : forall P : list name * network -> list name * network -> list (name * (input + list output)) ->...-> P p p0 l where ?P0 : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- BaseParams] ?P : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- MultiParams ?P0] ?params : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- FailureParams ?P]
acknowledged_op = fun (k : K) (trace : list op) => In (O k) trace : K -> list op -> Prop Arguments acknowledged_op _ _%list_scope
step_dup_ind : forall P : network -> network -> list (name * (input + list output)) -> Prop, (forall (net net' : network) (p : packet) (xs ys : list packet) (out : list output) (d : data) (l : list (name * msg)), nwPackets net = xs ++ p :: ys -> net_handlers (pDst p) (pSrc p) (pBody p) (nwState net (pDst p)) = (out, d, l) -> net' = {| nwPackets := send_packets (pDst p) l ++ xs ++ ys; nwState := update name_eq_dec (nwState net) (pDst p) d |} -> P net net' [(pDst p, inr out)]) ->...-> P n n0 l where ?P : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- BaseParams] ?params : [K : Type K_eq_dec : forall x y : K, {x = y} + {x <> y} |- MultiParams ?P]

```coq
intros P H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 H7 ir.
induction ir as [| ir' ir'' IH].
- apply H1.
- destruct ir' as [k | k | k].
  + destruct ir'' as [k' | k' | k'].
    * apply H3.
    * apply H4. apply IH.
    * apply H5. apply IH.
    * apply H7.
  + apply H6.
Qed.
```

original: intros P H1 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 H7 ir. induction ir as [| ir' ir'' IH]. - apply H1. - destruct ir' as [k | k | k]. + destruct ir'' as [k' | k' | k']. * apply H3. * apply H4. apply IH. * apply H5. apply IH. * apply H7. + apply H6.
